reference_summary:
Takers [Blu-ray] Paul Walker (Actor), Hayden Christensen (Actor) Rated: PG-13 Format: Blu-ray Movies & TV, Blu-ray, Movies ['This high-stakes action thriller stars Matt Dillon, Paul Walker, Idris Elba, Jay Hernandez, Michael Ealy and Tip “T.I.” Harris. After pulling off a spectacular series of brilliantly planned bank robberies, a notorious team of professional criminals attempts one last heist, a once-in-a-lifetime job with a $25 million payoff. And all that stands in their way is a cop hell-bent on doing whatever it takes to solve the case and bring the', 'Takers', 'down. Chris Brown and Hayden Christensen costar in an adrenaline-rushed thrill ride packed with twists and turns.'] {'Genre': 'Action, Drama', 'Format': 'AC-3, Blu-ray, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Contributor': 'Paul Walker, Hayden Christensen', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 47 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '2.40:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'PG-13 (Parents Strongly Cautioned)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 1.6 Ounces', 'Item model number': '15423113', 'Media Format': 'AC-3, Blu-ray, Dolby, Dubbed, NTSC, Subtitled, Widescreen', 'Run time': '1 hour and 47 minutes', 'Release date': 'January 18, 2011', 'Actors': 'Paul Walker, Hayden Christensen', 'Dubbed': 'Portuguese, French, Spanish', 'Subtitles': 'Spanish, French, English, Portuguese', 'Studio': 'Sony Pictures', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'} The only true robbery is by anyone buying this movie. It had been a long time since I've seen an action movie with such a combination of bad acting, horrible directing, a snoozer for a script and a cast that couldn't deliver their lines with any sort of skills. Rappers, C-list movie stars and singers make up this woeful cast of 'professional' bank robbers who only 'take' the big ones... the major chase scenes are so ridiculous you will roll your eyes and shake your head as you watch them.... there was a host of reasons a sequel wasn't made. Ugh.... {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Adam Arkin', 'Jon Avnet', 'Peter Werner', 'Michael Dinner', 'John Dahl', 'Bill Johnson', 'Michael W. Watkins', 'Gwyneth Horder-Payton', 'Don Kurt', 'Dean Parisot'], 'Producers': ['Sarah Timberman', 'Carl Beverly', 'Michael Dinner', 'Graham Yost', 'Elmore Leonard'], 'Studio': ['FX Cable Channel']} After finally taking advantage of my Amazon Prime membership's video feature the first show I began watching was "Justified' after hearing people (most notable Robin Quivers) say how good it is. I have to agree- it's well acted, written and directed. My favorite actor on the show after Timothy Olyphant is Erica Tazel. Enjoying discovering 'Justified'! {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Joe Chappelle', 'Ernest R. Dickerson', 'Clark Johnson', 'Ed Bianchi', 'Steve Shill', 'Daniel Attias', 'Timothy Van Patten', 'Agnieszka Holland', 'Brad Anderson', 'Clement Virgo'], 'Producers': ['David Simon', 'Robert F. Colesberry', 'Nina Kostroff Noble'], 'Starring': ['Dominic West', 'Sonja Sohn', 'Lance Reddick'], 'Studio': ['HBO Max']} Season 2 was a great successor to the 1st season- plenty of intrigue, crime, kingpins rising and falling. "The Wire" was an underrated gem! Flat out great! {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Timothy Van Patten', 'Allen Coulter', 'Jeremy Podeswa', 'Ed Bianchi', 'Brad Anderson', 'Alik Sakharov', 'Jake Paltrow', 'Simon Cellan Jones', 'Brian Kirk', 'Martin Scorsese'], 'Producers': ['Rudd Simmons', 'Terence Winter', 'Martin Scorsese', 'Tim Van Patten', 'Stephen Levinson', 'Mark Wahlberg'], 'Starring': ['Steve Buscemi', 'Michael Pitt', 'Kelly Macdonald'], 'Studio': ['HBO']} Steve Buscemi is great in this series about Atlantic City, bootlegging and the rise of some of the most famous gangsters in American history. Nearly perfect {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Alan Ball', 'Daniel Attias', 'Rodrigo García', 'Jeremy Podeswa', 'Kathy Bates', 'Michael Cuesta', 'Michael Engler', 'Alan Poul', 'Daniel Minahan', 'Miguel Arteta'], 'Producers': ['Alan Ball', 'Robert Greenblatt', 'David Janollari', 'Alan Poul', 'Bruce Eric Kaplan', 'Rick Cleveland', 'Bob Del Valle', 'Lori Jo Nemhauser', 'Craig Wright'], 'Starring': ['Peter Krause', 'Michael C. - **Content Preferences:** The user continues to favor action and drama genres, with a strong emphasis on narratives that feature complexity and deep character development. Their recent interaction reveals a consistent appreciation for well-crafted stories.

- **Entertainment Quality:** The user's latest rating of 5.0 reaffirms their commitment to exceptional production quality, reflecting their ongoing pursuit of high standards in acting, writing, and directing.

- **Rating Standards:** The user exhibits a willingness to engage with compelling narratives, highlighted by their positive review of a recent series. This shows an evolving appreciation for content that captivates and resonates, balancing critical evaluation with moments of recognition for outstanding storytelling.

- **Engagement Style:** Their straightforward and thoughtful review style articulates both strengths and weaknesses in content, showcasing a knack for recognizing exceptional performances and effective direction.

- **Interest in Star Power:** The user continues to place significant value on renowned actors, as their recent interaction suggests that star power greatly enhances their enjoyment, especially when aligned with exceptional narratives.

Overall, the user maintains a sophisticated taste in entertainment, prioritizing exemplary storytelling and performances. Their latest feedback underscores a sustained appreciation for impactful series, further solidifying their discerning approach to quality content.
